text: What national park are you interested in learning about?
here is info about Sariska Tiger Reserve

cardList.name: Sariska Tiger Reserve
cardList.location: Alwar district of the state of Rajasthan, India
cardList.desc: Sariska Tiger Reserve is a national park and tiger reserve. This area was a hunting preserve of the Alwar state and it was declared a wildlife reserve in 1955. It was given the status of a tiger reserve making it a part of India's Project Tiger in 1978. The wildlife sanctuary covers an area of 866 km2. The reserve was declared a national park in 1982, with a total area of about 273.8 km2. It is the first reserve in the world to have successfully relocated tigers.
